references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces the core methodology of latent diffusion models, which is the foundation of the proposed DDL-CXR model.

references.paper_title: MedFuse: Multi-modal fusion with clinical time-series data and chest X-ray images
references.reason: This is a key comparative baseline method used in the experiments, representing a state-of-the-art approach in multi-modal clinical data fusion.

references.paper_title: MIMIC-CXR, a de-identified publicly available database of chest radiographs with free-text reports
references.reason: This paper introduces the MIMIC-CXR dataset, the primary data source for the experimental validation of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: MIMIC-IV, a freely accessible electronic health record dataset
references.reason: This paper introduces the MIMIC-IV dataset, which is another data source used in the experimental validation and provides the EHR data that is crucial to the proposed method.
This foundational paper on denoising diffusion models provides the theoretical basis and algorithmic framework upon which the DDL-CXR model is built.
